definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
number 20 of the 28 constellations 二十八宿, approx. Orion 獵戶座|猎户座
lunar apogee (point in the moon's orbit furthest from earth)/imaginary heavenly body occupying the second focus of the moon's elliptic orbit/dark moon/Lilith
to bewilder/to dazzle and confuse/the planet Mars
seven heavenly bodies and four imaginary stars (in astrology and feng shui)
Antares, the brightest star in Scorpio 天蠍座|天蝎座[Tian1 xie1 zuo4]
to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]
same as 天干/the 10 heavenly stems 甲, 乙, 丙, 丁, 戊, 己, 庚, 辛, 壬, 癸 (used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal number like Roman I, II, III)
Arcturus (brightest star in the constellation Boötes 牧伕座|牧夫座[Mu4 fu1 zuo4])
